intro: Viola praemorsa var. altior, commonly known as the tall violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and deep green color. The plant produces violet-blue flowers with a distinctive white throat, blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders in horticulture.
